title: Inside Operation Sindoor: How India carried out precision strikes on Pak
content: In a retaliatory move for the Pahalgam terror attack, India launched "Operation Sindoor," executing precision strikes on nine terrorist bases across Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Kashmir.

title: '3 civilians killed in indiscriminate firing by Pak military across LoC, IB'
content: In a significant escalation, the Pakistan Army initiated unprovoked firing and artillery shelling along the Line of Control and International Border in Jammu and Kashmir, resulting in the tragic deaths of three civilians. This aggression follows India's launch of 'Operation Sindoor,' a counter-terror operation targeting terror infrastructure in Pakistan and PoK, in response to the Pahalgam terror attack.

title: 'Weapon systems of all three forces used in Op Sindoor': What we know
content: India launched Operation Sindoor, targeting nine terrorist infrastructure sites in Pakistan, following the Pahalgam attack that killed 25 Indian citizens and one Nepali national. The Ministry of Defence emphasized the operation was precise, restrained, and non-escalatory, focusing on locations used for planning attacks against India. A detailed briefing is scheduled, with the Indian Army declaring, "Justice is served."

title: CEOs Microsoft, Adobe, IBM, Cognizant and others warn US is falling behind
content: Top CEOs, including Microsoft's Satya Nadella, are urging the U.S. to mandate computer science and AI education in K-12 schools. They warn that America is lagging behind countries like China and Singapore. The leaders emphasize that a single computer science course could boost wages by 8% and unlock significant economic potential.

title: Pahalgam terror attack: Justice is served, says Indian Army
content: Following the deadly Pahalgam terror attack, Indian armed forces initiated 'Operation Sindoor,' targeting terrorist infrastructure within Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Kashmir. The strikes were described as focused and non-escalatory, avoiding Pakistani military facilities. Simultaneously, a nationwide civil defence mock drill is scheduled to enhance emergency preparedness across 244 districts.

title: Operation Sindoor: Flight service impacted in Northern India
content: Following India's 'Operation Sindoor' against terror camps in Pakistan-occupied Kashmir after the Pahalgam attack, IndiGo Airlines reports flight disruptions. Airspace changes over northern India are causing delays and cancellations for flights to and from Srinagar, Jammu, Amritsar, Leh, Chandigarh, Dharamshala, and Bikaner. Indian air defence units along the border are on high alert amid heightened tensions.

title: Air India diverts two international flights amid 'Operation Sindoor' airspace curbs
content: Air India diverted two international flights to Delhi due to air traffic disruptions following India's military action, 'Operation Sindoor', against terror camps in PoK. IndiGo and SpiceJet cautioned about potential delays and cancellations for flights to and from several northern cities.

title: Amazon changing salary structure, here's who new guidelines favour
content: Amazon is revamping its compensation strategy, rewarding veteran top performers with up to 110% of their pay range for consistent excellence over four years. First-time high achievers and those with fluctuating performance will see reduced payouts.

title: Operation Sindoor: India targets JeM & LeT headquarters in Pakistan
content: Indian Armed Forces launched 'Operation Sindoor,' targeting nine sites in Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Jammu and Kashmir, focusing on terrorist infrastructure of Jaish-e-Mohammed and Lashkar-e-Taiba, including their headquarters in Bahawalpur and Muridke. The strikes, a response to the Pahalgam terror attack, were precise and non-escalatory, specifically avoiding Pakistani military facilities.

title: NSA Ajit Doval speaks to US counterpart as India launches 'Operation Sindoor'
content: Following India's launch of Operation Sindoor, National Security Advisor Ajit Doval briefed his US counterpart and Secretary of State Marco Rubio, assuring them the strikes were precise, non-escalatory, and targeted only terror camps. US President Donald Trump, upon being informed, expressed hope for swift de-escalation.

title: Elon Musk is no longer ‘Elon Musk’ on Twitter; changes profile name to…
content: Elon Musk has once again altered his X display name, this time to 'Gorklon Rust,' sparking speculation about its meaning. The moniker appears to blend references to Grok, Musk's AI chatbot, and the Rust programming language, potentially linked to xAI's infrastructure.

title: MoU signed for cargo movement by barges over inland waterways
content: A hundred barges will be deployed in a phased manner across national waterways; the MoU between the Inland Waterways Authority of India and Rhenus Logistics targets the movement of over one million tonnes of cargo annually by the end of 2025

title: India launches ‘Operation Sindoor’, conducts strikes against terror infrastructure in Pakistan, PoK
content: No Pakistani military facilities have been targeted, government statement says; Army’s official X handle posts: “Justice is Served. Jai Hind”

title: Punjab CM Mann trying to create differences among people, says Haryana CM Saini
content: Mr. Saini has also alleged that the AAP government in Punjab is failing its electoral base of farmers, and will face defeat in next Punjab elections

title: Villagers oppose plan to build bus shelter near a Tasmac outlet
content: Villagers fear safety of commuters, especially women, will be compromised. Collector says objections have been taken up with the district administration

title: Telangana invites citizens to apply online for curated entry to Miss World 2025
content: Citizens can register on Telangana Tourism website to be considered through a curated selection process

title: Osman Nagar reservoirs getting ready for inauguration
content: Built at a cost of ₹30 crore, under the ORR phase 2 and package 2 project, the reservoirs will provide drinking water to nearly 1 lakh people in the area

title: BMTC responds after video shows elderly man misbehaving with woman passenger
content: The incident reportedly took place on May 5 around 3.30 p.m. on bus number KA51 F 6204, operating on route 276/22 near Vidyaranyapura

title: Early monsoon? Rains over Nicobar islands by May 13
content: The normal onset date of the monsoon over Kerala is June 1, and it usually takes about 10 days for the system to reach Kerala from the Nicobar islands

title: 'Focused, measured and non-escalatory in nature': Govt on 'Operation Sindoor'
content: In response to the deadly Pahalgam attack that killed 26, India launched "Operation Sindoor," targeting nine terrorist camps in Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Kashmir. The strikes were described as precise, measured, and non-escalatory, with no Pakistani military facilities targeted. This action follows Prime Minister Modi granting the armed forces full operational freedom.

title: Hold overdue Maha local polls within 4 months, SC tells state election panel
content: The Supreme Court has directed the Maharashtra State Election Commission to conduct local body elections within four weeks, disapproving of bureaucratic control due to election delays. The elections will proceed based on OBC reservation specifications as they existed before the Banthia Commission's report in July 2022, addressing concerns about the enumeration of the OBC population and ensuring grassroots democracy.

title: SC details assets of 21 judges, including CJI, and their kin
content: The Supreme Court has made asset details of its judges public. Twenty-one out of thirty-three judges, including the Chief Justice, have declared their wealth. This information is available on the court's website. This move follows the 'cash-at-kothi' scandal. Judges will now declare assets upon assuming office and significant acquisitions to the CJI. These declarations will be mandatorily published online.

title: India a rising AI powerhouse, talent retention growing: Report
content: The 2025 Human Development Report recognises India as a burgeoning "AI powerhouse," showcasing significant AI skills penetration and improved talent retention. Notably, 20% of Indian AI researchers now stay in the country, a stark contrast to 2019. The report emphasises AI's potential to revitalise development, with surveys indicating widespread optimism about its impact on productivity and job creation.

title: 17.5% women among 192 new HC judges
content: The Supreme Court has released data revealing increasing diversity in high court judge appointments, with significant representation from women, OBCs, and minorities. While a small percentage have familial ties to judges, a majority come from diverse backgrounds, challenging perceptions of upper-caste dominance. A few recommendations are pending with the Centre, raising concerns about delays.

title: Apple to source, produce all its mobiles in India in years to come: Scindia
content: Telecom Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia announced that Apple intends to manufacture all its mobile phones in India, highlighting the country's emergence as a reliable and affordable manufacturing hub. He emphasized the significant growth in the telecom equipment market, driven by the government's PLI scheme, resulting in substantial investments, sales, exports, and job creation.

title: Income and gender disparities in India still significant, says UNDP
content: India's Human Development Index ranking improved to 130th in 2023, driven by increased life expectancy and progress in education and income. The nation's HDI value has risen significantly since 1990, outpacing global and South Asian averages, fueled by economic growth and social programs. However, inequality continues to significantly reduce India's HDI, with income and gender disparities remaining a challenge.

title: Road crash victims will now get free, cashless treatment
content: The government has notified a scheme for free cashless treatment to road accident victims nationwide, complying with a Supreme Court deadline. Up to ₹1.5 lakh will be provided for treatment for a maximum of seven days at 30,000 designated hospitals. A steering committee will monitor the scheme's implementation, with ₹272 crore allocated for 2025-26.

title: Government seals trade pact with UK: Tariffs cut, savings for Indians on work visas
content: After three years of negotiations, India and the UK have finalized a trade agreement that eliminates tariffs on 99% of Indian exports and reduces duties on 90% of tariff lines. The deal includes exemptions from social security contributions for Indian workers on temporary visas, potentially saving them around 20% of their salary. PM Modi highlighted the agreement's potential to boost trade, investment, and job creation in both economies.

title: Omar, Mehbooba question ‘mass detentions’ after Pahalgam attack
content: Following the Pahalgam attack, Omar Abdullah and Mehbooba Mufti voiced concerns over large-scale detentions in J&K, fearing a message of collective punishment. Mehbooba highlighted that thousands of civilians have been taken into custody, with over 3,000 arrests and nearly 100 PSA detentions reported, urging a review of this approach to avoid deepening the trust deficit.

title: Two government school teachers give high-flyers a ride in the clouds
content: In Andhra Pradesh, two government school teachers sponsored air trips for seven high-achieving Class 10 students from underprivileged backgrounds, fulfilling a promise made to encourage academic excellence. The initiative motivated students to score high marks, with some experiencing their first-ever flight. This act of generosity highlighted the transformative impact of innovative teaching methods and the boundless opportunities that academic success can unlock.

title: At UNSC huddle, Pakistan faces tough questions
content: The UNSC's closed-door meeting on India-Pakistan tensions yielded no substantive outcome for Pakistan, with members advising bilateral resolution and accountability for the Pahalgam attack. Concerns were raised regarding Pakistan's nuclear rhetoric and missile tests, alongside questions about Lashkar-e-Taiba's potential involvement in the attack. Pakistan's efforts to internationalize the issue and promote a false-flag narrative faced disapproval.

title: IAF to launch major drill on Pakistan border from today
content: Amidst heightened tensions, India is set to conduct a major air combat exercise near the Pakistan border in Rajasthan, deploying frontline fighters and force multipliers. This follows naval drills in the Arabian Sea, signaling India's readiness. Simultaneously, DGMOs from both countries are in communication regarding ceasefire violations along the LoC, where small arms fire continues.

title: India’s water will flow, stop in India’s interests, be of use only to India: PM Modi
content: Amidst escalating tensions following the Pahalgam attack, Prime Minister Modi asserted India's control over its Indus waters, vowing to utilize them solely for the nation's benefit. Simultaneously, the IAF is preparing for a significant air combat exercise near the border, while military communication reveals ongoing concerns about unprovoked firing across the LoC, marking twelve consecutive nights of such incidents.

title: Gujarat Titans snatch thrilling last-ball win over Mumbai Indians in a rain-hit thriller
content: In a thrilling, rain-interrupted match at Wankhede, the Gujarat Titans clinched a nail-biting three-wicket victory against the Mumbai Indians on the very last ball. Chasing 156, Shubman Gill's 43 and crucial contributions down the order guided the Titans to the top of the league standings.

title: We act in India’s interest, not worried about world reaction: PM Modi
content: Prime Minister Modi asserted that India would utilize its rightful share of Indus River water, following the decision to pause the Indus Waters Treaty. He emphasized that the government prioritizes national interests, regardless of international reactions. Modi highlighted initiatives like river-linking projects to benefit farmers and reforms to empower marginalized communities, moving beyond vote-bank politics.

title: Health and education are foundations of a good society: Azim Premji
content: 63,982 candidates awarded certificates at the 27th convocation of Rajiv Gandhi University of Health Sciences

title: CBI special court sentences Gali Janardhan Reddy, three others to seven-year jail term in illegal mining case
content: Apart from the BJP MLA from Karnataka, his relative B.V. Srinivas Reddy, MD, Obulapuram Mining Corporation; V.D. Rajagopal, then Director of the Mining Department; and Janardan Reddy’s personal assistant, Ali Khan, were also convicted in the case registered by the CBI nearly 16 years ago

title: ICAR expels farmers’ member, who questioned genome-edited seeds, from governing body
content: The Indian Council of Agricultural Research (ICAR) expelled Varanasi-based farmer Venugopal Badaravada from the governing body as well as general body of the ICAR Society for sending various mails levying ‘frivolous, baseless and materially unsupported allegations’ against various authorities of the Centre, Department of Agricultural Research and Education and the ICAR over the last seven-eight months

title: Kodanad case: CB-CID questions Jayalalithaa’s former personal assistant Poongundran
content: According to sources, he was asked to give the details of the Kodanad bungalow’s CCTV camera system and whether any important documents were stored there

title: Over 10 crore pages of historic documents digitised by National Archives of India, says Culture Minister
content: Making the announcement, Union Culture Minister Gajendra Singh Shekhawat said the digitisation project was taken up to make historic documents in possession of the NAI more accessible to the public.

title: Stalin government steps into fifth year, focuses on inclusive and equitable development
content: The Chief Minister said his sole aim was to bring Tamil Nadu back onto the path of progress and the four-year journey of the Dravidian model stood testimony to his administration’s success

title: PM Modi speaks to Emir of Qatar as India steps up West Asia outreach
content: Tamim Bin Hamad Al Thani expresses full support to India’s fight against terrorism and all actions to bring the perpetrators of Pahalgam attack to justice; New Delhi rejects OIC statement as absurd

title: Emigration Act 1983 designed to address demands of particular geography in a certain era, says External Affairs Minister
content: S. Jaishankar says countries like Italy, Japan, Spain, and Malaysia among others have expressed interest in hiring Indian professionals in both blue collar and white collar positions and described these opportunities as just the ‘tip of the iceberg’

title: Pahalgam terror attack: CRPF seeks explanation from its first responder
content: Commandant Rajesh Kumar with a team of 22 people had rushed to the scene of massacre; eyewitnesses and survivors say security personnel reached the scene after more than an hour

title: Civil defence drills to be organised in five districts of Karnataka
content: In Karnataka, Mallapura, Shaktinagara and Bengaluru have been included in Category II civil defence towns

title: Human rights commission orders probe into rabies deaths
content: The inquiry should identify preventive measures to ensure such tragedies do not recur, according to the order

title: The first care home for beggars in Madras was established under police management
content:
On March 14, 1954, Chief Minister C. Rajagopalachari inaugurated a care home and camp at Melpakkam. The camp, which could accommodate 500 persons, started with 83 beggars. The inmates were given 2 square meals and kanji every day. The Medical Officer of the Government Dispensary at Poonamalee
visited them daily

title: Farmers protest U.K. trade deal saying it’s a threat to agriculture and MSMEs
content: Samyukt Kisan Morcha, allied unions allege pact enables ‘economic imperialism’, bypasses Parliamentary scrutiny, and endangers national interests

title: US air-sea platforms for nukes at end-of-service period: Report
content: The US Congressional Budget Office projects that the cost of operating, sustaining, and modernizing US nuclear forces will surge to $946 billion between 2025 and 2034, a 25% increase from the previous estimate. This substantial investment includes modernizing delivery systems, weapons, facilities, and command and control systems. The rise is attributed to the need to replace aging legacy weapon systems and address cost overruns in programs like the Sentinel ICBM.

title: 17 killed in rain-related mishaps across Gujarat, several injured
content: Unseasonal rain, thunderstorms, and strong winds have tragically resulted in 17 deaths across Gujarat in the past 24 hours. The severe weather, impacting 168 talukas, caused fatalities due to lightning, electrocution, and structural collapses. Amreli and Bhavnagar experienced heavy rainfall and fierce winds, providing relief from the heat but causing significant damage to crops like mango, onion, sesame, and bajra.

title: IPL 2025 Points Table: Latest standings after GT vs MI match
content: Gujarat Titans surged to the top of the IPL 2025 points table after defeating Mumbai Indians, securing their eighth win. Royal Challengers Bengaluru and Punjab Kings closely follow, intensifying the playoff race. Delhi Capitals remain in contention, while Sunrisers Hyderabad were eliminated. Rajasthan Royals and Chennai Super Kings have bowed out of playoff contention, making every remaining match crucial.

title: Assam to conduct caste census of seven native Muslim communities
content: Assam is gearing up for a caste census targeting its seven native Muslim communities, aiming to differentiate them from immigrant Muslims of Bangladesh origin. CM Sarma announced the initiative to fulfill the long-standing demand of Goria, Moria, Deshi, Syed, Jolha, Kiren, and Maimal Muslims. This enumeration seeks to formally recognize their distinct socio-cultural identities and preserve their unique heritage within Assam's diverse landscape.

title: Drop ‘Jagannath Dham’ from Digha temple name, Odisha CM urges Mamata
content: Odisha Chief Minister Mohan Charan Majhi has formally requested West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee to cease using the term 'Jagannath Dham' for the Digha temple, asserting that it exclusively pertains to Puri. This appeal follows widespread objections and concerns that the usage dilutes Puri's unique religious and cultural significance, potentially hurting the sentiments of numerous pilgrims and misrepresenting the revered abode of Lord Jagannath.

title: Manned Gaganyaan mission in first quarter of 2027: Jitendra Singh
content: India's Gaganyaan mission, aiming to send humans into space, is now slated for the first quarter of 2027, announced by space minister Jitendra Singh. Following successful test missions, including TV-D1, the program involves multiple institutions and the armed forces. The budget has increased to Rs 20,193 crore to accommodate eight missions, including uncrewed flights with the robot Vyommitra.

title: Iran foreign minister takes first strike in Pak as ‘mediator’, to land in Delhi today
content: Iranian Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi's recent diplomatic efforts in Islamabad, including meetings with Pakistani leaders, centered on mediating the escalating tensions between India and Pakistan following the Pahalgam terrorist attack. Despite India's reluctance to accept third-party mediation, Iran is positioning itself as a regional conciliator, leveraging its ties with both nations to push for de-escalation.

title: Calcutta high court: Lawyers now aligned with political parties
content: Calcutta High Court expressed concern over lawyers' political alignment and declining court decorum during a hearing on alleged police overreach in the Murshidabad violence case. Justice Tirthankar Ghosh observed that lawyers' power seems to stem from outside the courtroom, leading to heated exchanges. He refused to entertain the plea, directing it to a division bench already addressing Murshidabad violence-related cases.

title: New proposal: Pay Rs 7L, have 40 beach weddings in 3 years
content: The Goa Coastal Zone Management Authority (GCZMA) is considering a proposal to allow event organizers to obtain a three-year permit for hosting up to 40 weddings on specific beach stretches for a fee of Rs 7 lakh. The GCZMA has also proposed changes to application fees for various construction projects, including hotels, swimming pools, and infrastructure for petroleum products, while introducing fees for flood protection walls and coastal structures.

title: Army duo dead, 3 injured in Kupwara road accident
content: In a tragic incident near the Line of Control in Kupwara, an Army vehicle accident resulted in the death of two soldiers and injuries to two others. The vehicle plunged into a deep gorge after the driver lost control. This unfortunate event follows a similar accident in Ramban just two days prior, where three Army personnel lost their lives.

title: Government reviewing Act that regulates mobility: EAM S Jaishankar
content: Foreign Minister Jaishankar highlighted the significance of skill development and international mobility in enhancing India's global influence, emphasizing the need for legal pathways and combating illegal migration. The government is reassessing the Emigration Act 1983 to align with current realities and promote opportunities while safeguarding vulnerable individuals. He also acknowledged the increasing expectations of Indian citizens abroad for government support, especially in challenging situations.

title: Pak plans to increase defence budget by 18%: How it compares with India
content: Amidst escalating tensions following the Pahalgam attack, Pakistan plans to increase its defence budget by 18%. India, a major military power, spends significantly more but faces resource allocation challenges. With China's support for Pakistan and its own growing military strength, India confronts a two-front challenge. Recent actions include ceasefire violations, mock drills, and nuclear modernization, highlighting the complex security landscape.

title: Girl in district with 49% female literacy gets 100% in Boards
content: Pragya Jaiswal, a 16-year-old from Singrauli, MP, achieved a perfect score in her Class 10 state board exams, a remarkable feat in a district with low female literacy. Her success has inspired her village to prioritize girls' education and seek government support for a girls' school. Supported by her teacher parents, Pragya aims to become an IAS officer and is now seeking better educational opportunities for her Class 12 studies.

title: Rules for Cubbon Park: Government Order specifies what’s allowed and what’s prohibited
content: From a cap on the number of people who can gather for an event to a ban on consumption of food and certain toys, the guidelines have covered several aspects

title: The tale of Bharatha Matha temple, a pet project of C.R. Das and Subramania Siva
content:
Congress stalwarts C.R. Das and Subramania Siva initiated the 
Bharatha Matha temple at Paparapatti in Dharmapuri. After Siva died, it went out of public discourse. In June 2018, Chief Minister 
Edappadi K. Palaniswami of the AIADMK announced that the temple would be built at an estimated cost of ₹1.5 crore. It was declared open in August 2021

title: Govt amends satellite Internet service rules
content: The Department of Telecommunications issued a series of additional guidelines to satellite internet services, even as SpaceX’s Starlink continues to await the greenlight to offer its services in India.

title: Namma Metro introduces QR code ticket-vending machines at Byappanahalli station
content: The move follows the successful pilot launch of similar machines at M.G. Road and Cubbon Park stations on the Purple Line

title: BJP demands unconditional apology from Congress, calls Kharge’s remarks ‘irresponsible’
content: Party accuses Congress of weakening national security and aligning with anti-India narratives following remarks on Kashmir visit

title: Implement pre-exposure prophylaxis programme in State to prevent rabies death: KGMOA
content: If a person who has taken PrEP vaccine sustains animal bite, they nned to take only two booster shots

title: BBMP chief inspects footpaths in Bengaluru, issues slew of directions
content: Maheshwar Rao instructs officials to prioritise pedestrian infrastructure, remove encroachments, and widen the footpath at Shantala Silk Junction using the space available inside the bus stand

title: Population-based delimitation is fair, says BJP ally Upendra Kushwaha
content: Southern States were ‘denying the rights’ of other States, the Rashtriya Lok Morcha chief said it was the right of citizens in the Hindi-speaking States to be allocated Lok Sabha seats according to their numbers

title: Centre plans revision of ‘safe harbour’ clause in IT Act
content: I&B Ministry says it plans to revisit guidelines for intermediaries in a bid to to curb ‘fake news’; the IT Act provision protects the platforms by not holding them liable for the user-generated content

title: Financial impropriety forced Modi govt. to remove Subramanian as IMF executive director: Congress
content: Congress spokesperson Supriya Shrinate alleged that Union Bank of India placed an order for two lakh copies of a book authored by Subramanian, who had earlier served as Chief Economic Adviser to the Union government

title: Dhinakaran criticises DMK govt. for not fulfilling poll promises
content: He say the ‘singular achievement’ of the DMK government is to rake up issues with a view to deflect “dissatisfaction” of the public with the performance of the government

title: Supreme Court details 221 names approved by the Chandrachud and Khanna Collegiums
content: Only half of recommended names cleared; data reveals low representation from SC, ST, and OBC communities in HC appointments

title: Kerala firm weaves its magic at Met Gala
content: The striking blue carpet sprinkled with yellow and white daffodils that graced the fashion’s most dazzling event had its origins at Cherthala

title: India well-placed to conduct caste census, says Prof. Sukhdeo Thorat
content: Expert suggests careful preparation, learning from past efforts; calls for data on caste discrimination and sub-categorisation

title: Kerala to go global with Apple TV series
content: The series is a celebration of Kerala’s evolving narrative as a prime tourism destination and will help Kerala Tourism’s novel campaigns

title: ₹25 lakh ex gratia handed over to kin of Simhachalam wall collapse victims
content: Patti Durga Swamy Naidu, 33, and K.M.E. Sesha Rao, 26, natives of Machavaram village in Ambajipeta Mandal in Dr. B.R. Ambedkar Konaseema District were killed in the wall collapse

title: Digital luggage locker facility at Thiruvananthapuram Central railway station
content: SafeCloak is a self-operable, digital luggage storage solution that allows passengers to securely store their bags for a desired duration

title: Samastha seeks revocation of Asgar Ali Faizy’s expulsion from Arabic college
content: Faizy, a veteran scholar and senior Mushawara member, was expelled from Jamia Nooriyya Arabic College in March reportedly in retaliation for his veiled criticism against Indian Union Muslim League (IUML) State president Sadikali Shihab Thangal

title: Tirupati’s annual folk festival begins at Sri Tataiahgunta Gangamma temple
content: Priests tied ‘Vadibalu’ to the stone pillar located in front of the temple to announce the commencement of the festival

title: Stone laid for ₹12.72 crore Flatted Factory Complex in Srikalahasti
content: The project will be developed on 1.04 acres of land and will include 30 industrial units, with designated space for banks, storage and administrative facilities

title: Cruel Sommer: 'Special' save sends Inter to final
content: Internazionale goalkeeper Yann Sommer lauded his "special save" from Lamine Yamal after helping his side overcome Barcelona in a remarkable Champions League semifinal Tuesday.

title: Browns' Sanders to wear 12, like mentor Brady
content: The Browns on Tuesday announced jersey numbers for their rookies, and Shedeur Sanders will wear No. 12, as the No. 2 he wore in high school and college was selected by veteran DeAndre Carter.

title: High on future, Rockets vow to 'come back better'
content: Rockets coach Ime Udoka and GM Rafael Stone said the team took big steps this season but faces a "huge offseason" after being ousted in the first round of the playoffs.

title: Stolarz back with Maple Leafs, could play Game 2
content: Toronto coach Craig Berube said Tuesday that Maple Leafs goaltender Anthony Stolarz hasn't been ruled out of Wednesday's Game 2 of the second-round playoff series against the Florida Panthers after leaving Monday's opener in the second period.

title: Trump taps Andrew Giuliani to lead WC task force
content: President Donald Trump has appointed Andrew Giuliani, the son of former New York City Mayor Rudy Giuliani, to serve as the task force's executive director for the 2026 FIFA World Cup.

title: Frost's new deal at UCF totals 5 years, $22.1M
content: Through an executive summary obtained by The Associated Press on Tuesday, it was detailed that Scott Frost received a five-year, $22.1 million contract upon his UCF return, and it will automatically extend a year if the Knights play in a bowl this season.

title: Dodgers OF Hernandez (groin) out 'for a while'
content: An MRI showed that Dodgers outfielder Teoscar Hernandez has a Grade 1 groin strain, manager Dave Roberts told reporters Tuesday.

title: Clark's return to Iowa peaks at 1.6 million viewers
content: Caitlin Clark's return to Iowa's Carver-Hawkeye Arena for the WNBA preseason game between the Indiana Fever and Brazilian national team averaged 1.3 million viewers on ESPN.

title: 📈NFL Power Rankings: Re-shuffling after the draft
content: Our panel of experts ranked every NFL team from 1 to 32. Which franchises improved with their draft picks and offseason moves?

title: Biggest lessons of the Stanley Cup playoffs so far -- and why they matter for Round 2 and beyond
content: With the opening round in the books, here are the top takeaways that will influence the rest of the playoffs.

title: McDaniels on Curry? Mitchell’s volume shooting? Boston’s injuries? Six X factors in the second round
content: From players to coaching tactics to pace of play, these are six key factors that will be critical in the second round of the NBA playoffs.

title: 'Job well done': Inside Gregg Popovich's unparalleled NBA legacy
content: Friends, colleagues, players and confidantes all agree: Popovich has impacted more people across the game than perhaps anyone in history.

title: Inter Milan, Barcelona write new chapter in UCL folklore
content: Amazing goals, dazzling skill and drama at every turn: Inter's 7-6 aggregate defeat of Barça will go down as one of the Champions League's greatest-ever set of games.

title: Passan predicts MLB megadeals: Who will be next to get $100 million? $300 million? $600 million?!
content: These players are due to get paid -- from who will join the nine-figure club to who could break Juan Soto's record.

title: "World Can't Afford Military Confrontation Between India And Pak": UN Chief
content: UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres remains "very concerned" about India's military operation against Pakistan, saying "the world cannot afford a confrontation between the two countries", according to his Spokesperson Stephane Dujarric.

title: After India's Op Sindoor Success, Flood Of Misinformation From Pakistan
content: In the aftermath of India's military strikes on nine identified terror sites in Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Kashmir under Operation Sindoor, a wave of misinformation has emerged from Pakistani media and government-affiliated sources.

title: "Monitoring Closely": US After India Launches Air Strikes On Pakistan
content: US Secretary of State Marco Rubio said on Wednesday that he is closely monitoring the situation between India and Pakistan, following Indian missile strikes on multiple sites in Pakistan.

title: India Strikes 4 Terror Bases In Pak, 5 In POK In Response To Pahalgam Attack
content: Operation Sindoor: The Indian Armed Forces conducted strikes precisely at 1:44 am on terrorist infrastructure in Pakistan and Pakistan-Occupied Kashmir in response to the Pahalgam attack in which 26 civilians were killed on April 22.

title: Op Sindoor: Flights To Cities In Border Areas Impacted, Airlines Share Advisory
content: Several flights connecting major cities in northern states have been impacted due to airspace restrictions in view of the Indian armed forces' strikes on terror bases in Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Kashmir.

title: The Significance Of India's Strike On Muridke In Pakistan
content: India's calibrated military response to the Pahalgam terror attack included a strike on Muridke in Pakistan's Punjab, which is home to the headquarters of the Lashkar-e-Taiba and is known as the "terror nursery" of Punjab.

title: What Is Loitering Munition That India Used Against Pak In Operation Sindoor
content: Precision strike weapon systems from the Indian Army, Navy, and Air Force, including loitering munitions, were employed in Operation Sindoor, which successfully targeted 9 terror camps across Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Jammu and Kashmir (PoJK).

title: On  Balakot Strike List, 2 Operation Sindoor Targets. Why They Were Dropped
content: Two of the key targets in "Operation Sindoor" -- precision strikes on terror camps in Pakistan by the army and air force early today -- were on the army radar five years ago when the Balakote strikes happened, sources said.

title: Operation Sindoor Live Updates: India Strikes 9 Terror Bases In Pakistan In Historic Tri-Services Operation
content: Operation Sindoor Live Updates: The Indian armed forces early Wednesday carried out missile attacks on nine terror targets in Pakistan and Pakistan-Occupied Kashmir, including Bahawalpur which is a stronghold of the Jaish-e-Mohammad outfit,

title: India Reaches Out To US, UK, Russia Following 'Operation Sindoor'
content: India reached out to several leading countries, including the US, Russia, the UK and Saudi Arabia, early Wednesday and briefed them about the military strike it carried out on nine terror targets in Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied-Kashmir.

title: PM Modi Monitoring Operation Sindoor Through The Night: Sources
content: Operation Sindoor: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has been constantly monitoring Operation Sindoor, in which armed forces carried out missile strikes early Wednesday on nine terror targets in Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Kashmir.

title: Indigo Issues Flight Advisory As India Launches Strikes Against Pakistan
content: Amid the ongoing tensions between India and Pakistan following the Indian Army's precision strikes on Pakistani terror camps, Indigo Airlines issued a flight advisory for commuters flying to and from selected cities in the country.

title: Jai Hind, Bharat Mata Ki Jai: Ministers Applaud Military Action Against Terror Bases
content: Messages of "Jai Hind" and "Bharat Mata ki Jai" flooded social media platform X as Union ministers Rajnath Singh, Ashwini Vaishnaw, Piyush Goyal and others applauded the "Operation Sindoor"-- focussed strikes on terror camps in Pakistan and Pakistan-

title: Key Airports In Pak To Be Shut For 48 Hours After India's 'Operation Sindoor': Reports
content: After India's strikes in several parts of Pakistan, including Pakistan-occupied Kashmir and Pakistan Punjab, key airports in the country will remain shut for 48 hours, reports said.

title: Precision Strike At 9 Pak Terror Bases At 1:44 AM, Says India: 5 Facts
content: The Indian Armed Forces struck terrorist infrastructure in Pakistan and Pakistan-Occupied Kashmir post midnight in response to the Pahalgam terror attack in which 26 civilians were killed.

title: NFL experts debate the draft: Which teams have the most impactful rookie classes?
content: Could the Patriots' rookies make an immediate impact? Experts weigh in with their favorite classes and picks.

title: The worst good players: Which elite stars stink at passing? Who can't dribble or shoot?

title: Ronaldo's son earns first Portugal U15 call-up
content: Cristiano Ronaldo's eldest son, Cristiano Ronaldo Júnior, has been selected to play for Portugal's under 15 side for the first time for an upcoming international tournament in Croatia.

title: Rice: Arsenal need 'magic moments' to beat PSG
content: Declan Rice said Arsenal will require "magic moments" to reach their first Champions League final in 19 years.

title: Minister sorry to Liverpool fans over UCL final
content: France's former interior minister Gerald Darmanin has apologised to Liverpool fans for wrongly blaming them for the chaos before the 2022 Champions League final in Paris.

title: Busquets: Miami not at level of Club WC rivals
content: Inter Miami midfielder Sergio Busquets admitted the MLS club is not up to the level of competition that will be seen at the 2025 Club World Cup, but insisted the team will fight to advance out of the group stage.

title: Source: LAFC to host Club WC playoff on May 31
content: LAFC and América will face off on May 31 at LAFC's BMO Stadium for the right to replace Club León at the Club World Cup in the United States next month, a source confirmed to ESPN.

title: Shiffrin to join Denver NWSL ownership group
content: Two-time Olympic Alpine ski gold medalist Mikaela Shiffrin has joined the ownership group of Denver's expansion National Women's Soccer League team.

title: Source: Man Utd to resist any offers for Fernandes
content: A source has told ESPN that Bruno Fernandes is one of the few players whose future is seen as secure at Man United despite a battle to balance the club's books.

title: Raphinha on Barça revival: Xavi never rated me
content: Barcelona forward Raphinha has revealed his anger at the lack of football he played under Xavi Hernández, saying he feels his former coach never showed any real confidence in him.

title: Joe Burrow, Simone Biles shine on the 2025 Met Gala's red carpet
content: Sabrina Ionescu, Breanna Stewart, Joe Burrow, Jonathan Owens and Saquon Barkley make their debuts at the 2025 Met Gala.

title: "Hope It Ends Quickly": Trump As India Strikes Terror Bases In Pak
content: Reacting to India conducting precision strikes on terrorist bases in Pakistan in response to last month's attack in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam, US President Donald Trump has said the US knew something was going to happen.

title: "No Pak Army Facilities Targeted": Full India Statement On Precision Strikes
content: India launched precision strikes on nine sites in Pakistan, including in Pakistan-occupied Kashmir, on Wednesday in response to the killing of 26 people, mostly tourists, in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam on April 22.

title: Heavy Shelling By Pak Troops Along LoC In J&K As India Strikes Terror Camps
content: Pakistani troops resorted to heavy cross border shelling along the Line of Control in Karnah area of Kupwara district early Wednesday, less than two hours after India launched air strikes against terror targets in Pakistan and PoK.

title: Who will kick for Ravens after Justin Tucker release? A look at his likely successor

title: Operation Sindoor: For First Time Since 1971 War, All 3 Forces Strike Pakistan
content: A detailed briefing on 'Operation Sindoor' will happen later today. (Representational) Two weeks after the horrific Pahalgam terror attack, the Indian Army, Navy and Air Force in a joint operation carried out precise missile strikes early Wednesday on nine terror targets in Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Kashmir. This is the first time since the 1971 war that all three defence services have been used together against Pakistan. Here's what we know about Operation Sindoor: Track  Latest News  Live on NDTV.com and get  news  updates from  India   and around the  world

title: Justice Served: Army After Striking Terror Bases in Pak In Response To J&K Attack
content: the army launched "focused strikes" on terror infrastructure in pakistan and Kashmir . sources say prime minister was monitoring the "Operation Sindoor" through the night . the strikes were "focussed", "calibrated" and "non-escalatory" in nature .
